Direct Known Subclasses:
XMLHttpReflector
public abstract class XMLHttpServer
extends XMLHttpContext

An abstract class for XML & HTTP serialization contexts at server-side.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

call

protected abstract java.lang.Object call(ObjectLike base,
                                         ArrayLike<?> args)

Calls this context as a server-side method with the base object and arguments.

Parameters:
base - The base object for calling.
args - An array of arguments for the calling.
Returns:
The result of the call.

1.0

respond

public final java.lang.String respond(org.xml.sax.InputSource is)
                               throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                      org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                      java.io.IOException

Makes this connection context respond against a InputSource.

Parameters:
is - The InputSource to the connection context.
Returns:
The response XML document for the remote call.

org.xml.sax.SAXException
